poem:
**Cartoon Shadows**

John sketched
Bond swaying in the paper  
Even as his pen  
Dried on yesterday's ink.  
Machismo, black and white,  
Cornered in newsprint—  
You only live twice,  
Or so they say;  
Echoes, now in glass,  
Daring the museum air  
To forget.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "British artist’s cartoons that inspired Bond films on show at Oscars museum “You only live twice, or so it seems” – at least, that is, if you are the work of the late illustrator John McLusky, ­creator of the popular James Bond newspaper cartoon strips. His dynamic, almost-forgotten drawings brought a reliable touch of glamorous machismo into the lives of readers of the Daily Express between 1958 and 1966, and are now to stir again.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: British artist’s cartoons that inspired Bond films on show at Oscars museum “You only live twice, or so it seems” – at least, that is, if you are the work of the late illustrator John McLusky, ­creator of the popular James Bond newspaper cartoon strips. His dynamic, almost-forgotten drawings brought a reliable touch of glamorous machismo into the lives of readers of the Daily Express between 1958 and 1966, and are now to stir again.
